question: Many countries are experiencing serious problems with their environment, with pollution of their land, water and air.What are these problems and how might they be reduced?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.Write at least 250 words.
text: now, Many countries are suffering from enormous environmental problems. especially the pollution problem of their land, water, and air. This essay will examine the main causes of pollution and possible solutions to this problem.

I think the reasons are using chemical pesticides, human  wastes and factory gases. When farmers use  chemical pesticides to control pests, some of these chemicals do not degrade and still years in the soil. For example, D.D.T, a dangerous pesticide, still exists in  agricultural lands. Although, it has been used for 30 years. Furthermore, throwing human misuse into the river or seas pollute water. For instance, you can see dead fish on the riversides where  human wastes are found. Also, factories and cars come out of gases that pollute the atmosphere. To illustrate, a problem of the ozone layer led to an increase in the world temperature medium grade. Thus, the world faces many serious environmental issues with  contamination.

I can suggest some solutions that may help. The first one is using bio-pesticides, it is safe and degrade swiftly in the soil. Such as, Abamectin is a bio-pesticide that degrades  3 days after spraying the plants.  The second solution is to put new laws that prevent getting rid of waste in the water. The third solution is to use a kind of filter which reduces the harmful gases from mixing with the atmosphere. All these solutions will reduce the contamination in all three parts to the safe side.

In conclusion,  contamination is a big issue that needs  international interest from  world countries. And we can overcome it by using bio-pesticides, legislating effective laws against throwing wastes  and using gas filters.
